page.title: 01Hebron,Heighley & Espley
page.content: This area is mostly farmland which has changed verylittle over the year, except there is now more land cultivated for growing crops rather than grassland for grazing cattle and sheep on part of the most southerly section running adjacent to the main A1 truck road there is a fruit and vegetablle picking farm and slightly nrth west of this a very large garden centre. One of the large estates, Espley Hall, part of the land has been sold to adjoining farms to make up for land taken for opencast mining east of Hebron village. Espley Hall property is now a restaurant and function centre Hebron Village has enlarged with the addition of a small bungalow estate. The church is still the only community centre.
